text: There was a very good man, but very unfortunate. The more he failed in his endeavours, and the more earnestly he prayed to God every day when he went to Mass for the fulfillment of his requests, the more adversely he faced fortune. And his wife and his children became sick afterwards; and he prayed earnestly to Jehovah to heal them, and they died; and he had a contention, and had all his substance hanging upon him; and he prayed earnestly to Jehovah, and he lost it. But he did not grow weary, nor did his heart fail, and said, "The Lord will not let me ask of him; may his holy will be done. I will not ask of him any more of the things of the world". When he heard the Lord's Prayer, he bowed down before the image of the Lord and worshiped him. "Lord, " he said, "John is here". And he went on, and he was living his holy and miserable life, saying every day, and worshipping before the altar, Lord, behold, John is here. He died quietly, and as his soul reached heaven he repeated his humble cry: "Lord, here is John!" And then the doors opened up in a twist. Popular tales, fortunes and refrains, 1921
title: Señor, aquí está Juan
author: Fernán Caballero
